statsExpressions 0.6.0.9000

    • Dataframe outputs
    • Test and effect size details
  • Changelog

Dataframe outputs

Indrajeet Patil

2020-10-26

Source: vignettes/dataframe_outputs.Rmd
dataframe_outputs.Rmd

Introduction

Although the primary focus of this package is to get expressions containing statistical results, one can also use it to extract dataframes containing these details. This vignette catalogs dataframe outputs from all functions.

A dataframe will typically contain the following columns:

  • statistic: the numeric value of a statistic.

  • parameter: the numeric value of a parameter being modeled (often degrees of freedom for the test); note that if no.parameters = 0L (e.g., for non-parametric tests), this column will be irrelevant.

  • parameter1, parameter2 relevant only if the statistic in question has two degrees of freedom (e.g., anova).

  • p.value the two-sided p-value associated with the observed statistic.

  • estimate: estimated value of the effect size.

  • conf.low: lower bound for effect size estimate.

  • conf.high: upper bound for effect size estimate.

For details about the tests and types of effect size estimates they correspond to, see: https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/statsExpressions/articles/stats_details.html

One-sample tests

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "parametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic p.value parameter method            alternative estimate ci.width
#>       <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>             <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1    0.0504   0.960        55 One Sample t-test two.sided    0.00665     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1   -0.254     0.267

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "nonparametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   statistic    p.value method                                              
#>       <dbl>      <dbl> <chr>                                               
#> 1      5.51 0.00000738 Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction
#>   alternative estimate conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 two.sided       -0.6   -0.830    -0.393

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "robust",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 4
#>   estimate conf.low conf.high p.value
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1   0.0211   0.0107    0.0685       0

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "bayes",
  bf.prior = 0.8,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference  0.00952   -0.250     0.255 0.532           0.619
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component    bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>       <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0         0.8 fixed  conditional 0.130
#>   log_e_bf10
#>        <dbl>
#> 1      -2.04

Two-sample tests

within-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# data
df <- dplyr::filter(bugs_long, condition %in% c("LDLF", "LDHF"))

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_parametric(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic       p.value parameter method        alternative estimate ci.width
#>       <dbl>         <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>         <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      6.65 0.00000000222        90 Paired t-test two.sided      0.691     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    0.465     0.922

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_nonparametric(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   statistic      p.value method                                              
#>       <dbl>        <dbl> <chr>                                               
#> 1      7.72 0.0000000241 Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction
#>   alternative estimate conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 two.sided      0.580     0.47       0.7

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_robust(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   statistic parameter       p.value effect_size `NULL` estimate     S     M
#>       <dbl>     <dbl>         <dbl> <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1      6.71        72 0.00000000375 AKP              0    0.621   0.1   0.3
#>       L conf.low conf.high
#>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1   0.5    0.385     0.798

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_bayes(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference    -1.62    -2.12     -1.14     1               0
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component       bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>          <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional 4762370.
#>   log_e_bf10
#>        <dbl>
#> 1       15.4

between-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
expr_t_parametric(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic p.value parameter method                  alternative estimate
#>       <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                   <chr>          <dbl>
#> 1      1.92  0.0606      55.3 Welch Two Sample t-test two.sided      0.488
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1     0.95  -0.0212     0.993

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
expr_t_parametric(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic p.value parameter method            alternative estimate ci.width
#>       <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>             <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      1.92  0.0604        58 Two Sample t-test two.sided      0.488     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1  -0.0212     0.993

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_nonparametric(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   statistic p.value method                                           
#>       <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                                            
#> 1      6.36  0.0645 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction
#>   alternative estimate conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 two.sided       0.24  -0.0055      0.47

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_robust(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 6
#>   statistic parameter p.value estimate conf.low conf.high
#>       <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1      2.05      45.2  0.0460    0.384   0.0401     0.659

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_bayes(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference    -3.16    -6.66     0.528 0.960          0.0424
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component    bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>       <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional  1.20
#>   log_e_bf10
#>        <dbl>
#> 1      0.181

One-way ANOVAs

within-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_parametric(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic parameter1 parameter2  p.value group           term      estimate
#>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>           <chr>        <dbl>
#> 1      20.6       2.63       229. 8.27e-11 rowid:condition condition   0.0783
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1     0.95   0.0217     0.140

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_nonparametric(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   statistic  p.value parameter method                 estimate conf.low
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      55.8 4.56e-12         3 Friedman rank sum test    0.615    0.615
#>   conf.high
#>       <dbl>
#> 1     0.906

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_robust(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 4
#>   statistic parameter1 parameter2  p.value
#>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      21.2       2.69       191. 4.79e-11

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_bayes(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 96 x 19

#>    prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component          bf10
#>    <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>             <dbl>

#>  2 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1372773375.

between-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
expr_anova_parametric(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic parameter1 parameter2  p.value
#>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      139.          2       92.2 1.51e-28
#>   method                                                   term    estimate
#>   <chr>                                                    <chr>      <dbl>
#> 1 One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances) Species    0.612
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1     0.95    0.517     0.683

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
expr_anova_parametric(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic parameter1 parameter2  p.value method                    term   
#>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                     <chr>  
#> 1      119.          2        147 1.67e-31 One-way analysis of means Species
#>   estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    0.612     0.95    0.517     0.683

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_nonparametric(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   statistic  p.value parameter method                       estimate conf.low
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>     <int> <chr>                           <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      96.9 8.92e-22         2 Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test    0.651    0.560
#>   conf.high
#>       <dbl>
#> 1     0.724

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_robust(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   statistic parameter1 parameter2 p.value estimate conf.low conf.high
#>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1      124.          2       71.6       0    0.916    0.861     0.984

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_bayes(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 18
#>   term               estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>                 <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 mu                   5.84     5.76       5.93  1               0    
#> 2 Species-setosa      -0.829   -0.947     -0.713 1               0    
#> 3 Species-versicolor   0.0916  -0.0275     0.208 0.936           0.434
#> 4 Species-virginica    0.737    0.618      0.852 1               0    
#> 5 sig2                 0.267    0.210      0.335 1               0    
#> 6 g_Species            2.15     0.188     15.0   1               0    
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component      bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>         <dbl>
#> 1 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  extra       1.87e28
#> 2 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1.87e28
#> 3 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1.87e28
#> 4 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1.87e28
#> 5 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  extra       1.87e28
#> 6 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  extra       1.87e28
#>   log_e_bf10    r2 std.dev ci.width r2.conf.low r2.conf.high
#>        <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667
#> 2       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667
#> 3       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667
#> 4       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667
#> 5       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667
#> 6       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667

Contingency table analyses


# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# create data structure
paired_data <-
  structure(
    list(
      response_before =
        structure(
          c(1L, 2L, 1L, 2L),
          .Label = c("no", "yes"),
          class = "factor"
        ),
      response_after = structure(
        c(1L, 1L, 2L, 2L),
        .Label = c("no", "yes"),
        class = "factor"
      ),
      Freq = c(65L, 25L, 5L, 5L)
    ),
    class = "data.frame",
    row.names = c(NA, -4L)
  )

# ------------------------ association tests -----------------------------

# unpaired
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  paired = FALSE,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   statistic p.value parameter method                     estimate ci.width
#>       <dbl>   <dbl>     <int> <chr>                         <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      8.74  0.0126         2 Pearson's Chi-squared test    0.464     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1        0     0.777

# paired
set.seed(123)
statsExpressions::expr_contingency_tab(
  data = paired_data,
  x = response_before,
  y = response_after,
  paired = TRUE,
  counts = "Freq",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   statistic  p.value parameter method                     estimate ci.width
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      13.3 0.000261         1 McNemar's Chi-squared test    0.333     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    0.164     0.427


# ------------------------ goodness of fit tests ---------------------------

# with counts
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   statistic  p.value parameter method                                   estimate
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                                       <dbl>
#> 1      133. 9.65e-29         3 Chi-squared test for given probabilities    0.272
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1     0.95    0.222     0.316

Correlation analyses

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "parametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.low conf.high statistic parameter  p.value
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <int>    <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.868   -0.934    -0.744     -9.56        30 1.29e-10
#>   method  n.obs
#>   <chr>   <int>
#> 1 Pearson    32

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "nonparametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value method  
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>   
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.886   -0.943    -0.778      9.24 1.49e-11 Spearman
#>   n.obs
#>   <int>
#> 1    32

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "robust",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.low conf.high statistic parameter  p.value
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.896   -0.948    -0.796     -10.9        30 6.25e-12
#>   method          n.obs
#>   <chr>           <int>
#> 1 Percentage Bend    32

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "bayes",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term  estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage prior.distribution
#>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>             
#> 1 rho     -0.843   -0.934    -0.734     1               0 cauchy            
#>   prior.location prior.scale effect component        bf10 log_e_bf10
#>            <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>           <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1              0       0.707 fixed  conditional 56223033.       17.8

Meta-analysis

# setup
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)
library(metaplus)

# renaming to what `statsExpressions` expects
df <- dplyr::rename(mag, estimate = yi, std.error = sei)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "parametric")
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   term    type    estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 overall summary   -0.767     0.212     -3.62 0.000295    -1.18    -0.351

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "robust")
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value weight
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.746     0.234    -1.26    -0.343     -3.19 0.000777     NA

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "bayes")
#> # A tibble: 2 x 10
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high  bf10  rhat   ess log_e_bf10
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.467     0.165   -0.788    -0.143  39.2  1    6575.       3.67
#> 2 tau        0.439     0.185    0.140     0.809  NA    1.00 4260.      NA   
#>   prior.scale
#>         <dbl>
#> 1       0.707
#> 2       0.707
